channel.title: Brandon Boswell
channel.description: Recent content from Brandon Boswell's Digital Garden

item.title: Drinking is borrowing happiness from tomorrow
YouTube Checklist
item.description: Ideation / Writing Come up with 10 Title Options What should the thumbnail be? Write an Outline Write a script and/or Intro What is the hook? What is the outro? What conversation should I drive in the comments?
item.content:encoded:
Ideation / Writing

  • Come up with 10 Title Options
  • What should the thumbnail be?
  • Write an Outline
  • Write a script and/or Intro
    • What is the hook?
  • What is the outro?
    • What conversation should I drive in the comments?
    • Where should I send the user at the end of the video?
      • Is there another video I can mention or reference in this video?
      • Newsletter?
      • Knowledge Worker’s Discord?

Production / Edit

  • Make a Thumbnail
  • Record the A-Roll
  • Edit the Dialog (Note any B-Roll you will need)
  • Record B-Roll
  • Final Edit
  • Chop up any long-running clips (to stay interesting)
  • Jot Down the Chapters

Publish

  • Write a Description
  • Add Tags
  • Schedule
  • Promote on Mastodon
  • Post to the Discord
  • Mention on Reddit

item.title: Content to be consumed by the general public should be written at an eighth grade or lower reading level
A typical Skillshare course is less than an hour of content
item.description: Skillshare classes, on average, include 20-60 minutes of pre-recorded video content broken down into a series of short, 2- to 8-minute videos. — How Learning on Skillshare Works Skillshare
item.content:encoded:

item.title: Minimalism
item.description: “If you want a golden rule that will fit everything, this is it: Have nothing in your houses that you do not know to be useful or believe to be beautiful.
item.content:encoded: “If you want a golden rule that will fit everything, this is it: Have nothing in your houses that you do not know to be useful or believe to be beautiful.” —William Morris

item.title: Great tools convert something you can do into something you want to do
item.description: For example Cleanshot X has made it much more likely that I am going to share my screenshots because making them beautiful got signficantly easier. I could have done it before, but I wasn’t going to because the hassle was too high.
item.content:encoded: For example Cleanshot X has made it much more likely that I am going to share my screenshots because making them beautiful got signficantly easier. I could have done it before, but I wasn’t going to because the hassle was too high.

item.title: Design thinking
item.description: is an iterative and non-linear process that contains five phases: Empathize Define Ideate Prototype Test The overall goal is to identify alternative strategies and solutions that are not instantly apparent with your initial level of understanding.
item.content:encoded:
is an iterative and non-linear process that contains five phases:

  1. Empathize
  2. Define
  3. Ideate
  4. Prototype
  5. Test

The overall goal is to identify alternative strategies and solutions that are not instantly apparent with your initial level of understanding.

  • understand your users
  • challenge assumptions
  • redefine problems

item.title: weeded over garden effect
item.description: Coined by Daniel Doyon This set of locations was designed to enable an Inbox Zero workflow to prevent one of the core problems with Instapaper and Pocket: you save a bunch of items to read later, you cherry pick the high quality items off the top leaving behind the junk, and the user experience of your queue steadily degrades.
item.content:encoded:
Coined by Daniel Doyon

This set of locations was designed to enable an Inbox Zero workflow to prevent one of the core problems with Instapaper and Pocket: you save a bunch of items to read later, you cherry pick the high quality items off the top leaving behind the junk, and the user experience of your queue steadily degrades.

This same thing likely exists in your Task Manager as you do the high-priority and quick win tasks and are left with the less important (or perhaps very important, but you are avoiding) tasks that clutter up your user experience.

item.title: Positioning your Startup
item.description: She wrote this article called “Positioning Your Startup is Vital – Here’s How to Nail It.” She advises using a formula – and it’s a little bit of a Mad Libs game for a target customer who has a need or an opportunity.
item.content:encoded:
She wrote this article called “Positioning Your Startup is Vital – Here’s How to Nail It.” She advises using a formula – and it’s a little bit of a Mad Libs game for a target customer who has a need or an opportunity. [Your product] is in a [product category] that provides [some key benefits], and unlike [competitors], [your product] has these [differentiators].

Arielle Jackson
